correctImplementations
Class JourneyPlanner

java.lang.Object
  correctImplementations.JourneyPlanner

public class JourneyPlanner
extends java.lang.Object

A tool to help plan pedestrian journeys in a large city's central business district which is laid out in a 10-block grid.

Version:
1.0 (correct)
Author:
Colin Fidge

Constructor Summary
JourneyPlanner(int walkingSpeed)
          When constructed a journey planner needs to know how many minutes it takes you to walk one city block on average.
 
Method Summary
 int journeyTime()
          Returns the journey time from the origin to the destination (calculated using Manhattan distances).
 boolean setDestination(int X, int Y)
          Sets the destination for your planned journey (provided a valid coordinate is supplied).
 boolean setOrigin(int X, int Y)
          Sets the origin for your planned journey (provided a valid coordinate is supplied).
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Constructor Detail

JourneyPlanner

public JourneyPlanner(int walkingSpeed)
               throws java.lang.Exception
When constructed a journey planner needs to know how many minutes it takes you to walk one city block on average.

Parameters:
walkingSpeed - how many minutes it takes you to walk one block
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if the given speed is zero or negative
Method Detail

setOrigin

public boolean setOrigin(int X,
                         int Y)
Sets the origin for your planned journey (provided a valid coordinate is supplied).

Parameters:
X - the origin's X-coordinate from 0 to 10
Y - the origin's Y-coordinate from 0 to 10
Returns:
true if a valid origin has been supplied, false otherwise

                              int Y)
Sets the destination for your planned journey (provided a valid coordinate is supplied).

Parameters:

Y - the destination's Y-coordinate from 0 to 10
Returns:

journeyTime

public int journeyTime()
Returns the journey time from the origin to the destination (calculated using Manhattan distances).

Returns:
your journey time in minutes
